awd_titl_txt: TRIPODS+X:EDU: Foundational Training in Neuroscience and Geoscience via Hackweeks
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
Data-driven science and engineering requires close collaboration and coordination among researchers from different communities, including core sciences, statistics, and optimization. This project aimed to build on and expand the successful hackweek model as a model for data science education and collaboration, to bring together participants from domain sciences (specifically neuroscience and geoscience) with experts in modeling, machine learning, and optimization. By designing and offering tutorials on core methods, together with hands-on sessions based on Python notebooks, the principal investigators on this project provided foundational training for scientist participants of hackweeks. At the same time, the PIs strived to promote a deeper understanding and closer collaboration of both data-driven scientific problems in neuroscience and geoscience, as well as fundamental methodologies and how they apply to these sciences. 

The outcomes of the project include three hackweek events, two in 2019 which were conducted in person, and one in 2020 which was conducted fully virtually due to the global pandemic. For all events, attempts were made to recruit participants of diverse backgrounds, both academically and demographically. The tutorial material used in these events, including lectures and self-contained Python notebooks with hands-on exercises, were both used in these events and made available publicaly on Github. A subset of the developed notebooks have already been used in a new undergraduate course on Fundamentals Of Optimization and Machine Learning at UW. 


Last Modified: 05/31/2022
Modified by: Maryam Fazel
